content.p: Cookies help us to give you the best experience on our website. You can change your cookie settings if you wish. Otherwise we'll assume you're OK to continue.OKSee our policy Everything you need to know about using University of Nottingham Libraries Our eight libraries are home to subject-specific resources, study spaces and IT facilities. You can access many of our library resources and services online, including your library induction. Discover library events Boost your Study Skills Find your subject guide Attend a library induction online to help get you started with visiting our libraries, finding resources and using our services. Bookable and drop-in library tours are available for a guided visit that will help you navigate our libraries and explore the facilities available. Study spaces are available all of our libraries. We offer a range of spaces including quiet, silent, group and postgraduate spaces. Just drop-in or alternatively, you can book space in advance online using Click and Study. We also offer dedicated study spaces for students who are eligible for Enhanced Library Support. You can borrow up to 60 books from our libraries. Books are usually issued for seven days and will automatically renew until they are requested by someone else. NUsearch is your one stop shop for searching our library collections - including books, journals, databases and more. Click and Collect - Request books on NUsearch for collection from your preferred library. IT Induction Hub Print, copy, scan services are available in all libraries and computer rooms. Everything you need to know to get started with our libraries. King's Meadow Campus Lenton Lane Nottingham, NG7 2NR Please see our Help and support page for telephone and email contact points
